connector.description: Send and receive PostgreSQL events via LISTEN and NOTIFY commands.

camel.sink.path.host.name: camel.sink.path.host
camel.sink.path.host.description: To connect using hostname and port to the database.

camel.sink.path.port.name: camel.sink.path.port
camel.sink.path.port.description: To connect using hostname and port to the database.

camel.sink.path.database.name: camel.sink.path.database
camel.sink.path.database.description: The database name. The database name can take any characters because it is sent as a quoted identifier. It is part of the endpoint URI, so diacritical marks and non-Latin letters have to be URL encoded.

camel.sink.endpoint.datasource.name: camel.sink.endpoint.datasource
camel.sink.endpoint.datasource.description: To connect using the given javax.sql.DataSource instead of using hostname and port.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.pgevent.lazyStartProduce.name: camel.component.pgevent.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.pgevent.lazyStartProduce.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.pgevent.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.pgevent.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.pgevent.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
